meanings.sent1: The young fellows played soccer in the park.
meanings.sent2: The fellows helped carry the heavy boxes.
meanings.sent3: The fellows raced each other to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The fellows were like a pack of energetic puppies.
meanings.sent5: The fellows chatted happily as they walked home together.

meanings.sent1: My loyal fellow always listens to my stories.
meanings.sent2: She and her fellow went on a hike in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The two fellows shared a big pizza for dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her fellow was a pillar of support during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The fellow and his dog were inseparable companions.

meanings.definition: A member of a learned society or professional organization
meanings.sent1: The medical fellow presented his research findings.
meanings.sent2: She became a fellow of the prestigious academy.
meanings.sent3: The fellows discussed the latest advancements in technology.
meanings.sent4: Becoming a fellow was a great achievement for her.
meanings.sent5: The fellows attended the conference to share their expertise.

meanings.definition: A person in the same position, involved in the same activity, or otherwise associated with another
meanings.sent1: The marketing fellows collaborated on the new campaign.
meanings.sent2: He and his fellow interns worked late to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The fellows shared a passion for photography.
meanings.sent4: She found a kindred spirit in her fellow artist.
meanings.sent5: The fellows supported each other through thick and thin.
